frame.name: Guilt_or_innocence
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Accused</fen> individual is deemed by a (usually implicit) <fen>Judge</fen> to be involved (or not) in a <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
<ex><fex name="acc">I</fex> <m>am</m> <t>innocent</t> <fex name="mis">of this crime</fex> and so is James Griffiths . </ex> <ex>It is possible that <fex name="acc">the Frauleins Krabbe , Breuer and Moller</fex> are <t>guilty</t> <fex name="mis">of serious wrongdoing</fex>.</ex>
<ex></ex> Note that this frame is not limited to technical, legal uses. The use of guilty in this frame is also to be distinguished from that in the Contrition frame by not referring to an emotional state. Innocent has several other meanings that are distinct from the one it has in this frame. It can mean 'ignorant of'; 'innocuous'; 'pure and unsullied by experience'.</def-root>

FE.name: Accused
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the person who is accused of a <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
<ex><fex name="acc">Frank Quattrone</fex> is found <t>guilty</t> of obstructing federal investigations</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Misdeed
FE.definition:
<def-root>The wrongful act which the <fen>Accused</fen> was purportedly involved in.
<ex>Cambridge woman says she's <t>innocent</t> <fex name="mis">of fraud</fex>. </ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Viewpoint
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in connecting the <fen>Accused</fen> to the <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Accused</fen> is involved in the <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
<ex>Sammy Sosa was <fex name="deg">completely</fex> <t>guilty</t> of corking.</ex> <ex>For his part, the writer is <fex name="deg">somewhat</fex> <t>guilty</t> of his usual charges: undue casual talk of nudity.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: guilty.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: justly chargeable with a particular fault or error

lexUnit.name: innocent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not guilty of a crime or offence

lexUnit.name: guilt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the fact of having committed an offence or crime

lexUnit.name: innocence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: freedom from willful involvement in a particular crime or offense

lexUnit.name: blood on hands.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: guilt, especially for having caused death or injury.
